thread.title: Mets vs. Dodgers Game 3 live updates
thread.title_full: Mets vs. Dodgers Game 3 live updates

title: Mets vs. Dodgers Game 3 live updates
text:
Mets fans remember playoffs at Shea 
Chase Utley, who broke Ruben Tejada's leg on a takeout slide in Game 2, is not in the Dodgers' lineup, but is eligible to play after appealing his two-game suspension. Wilmer Flores will play in place of Tejada. Stats Game 3 boxscore: Mets vs. Dodgers Vote Mets vs. Dodgers: Who has the edge? See also 2006 vs. 2015: Which Mets team is better? 
Follow along for live updates each inning. 
Top of 1st: The start of the game was delayed because the replay phone in the Dodgers' dugout wasn't operational. After Harvey completed warmups and was about to throw out the first pitch, home plate umpire Greg Gibson came out to the mound to talk to Harvey. Dodgers manager Don Mattingly quickly came out of the dugout as the umpires conferred. Terry Collins followed shortly thereafter. After about five minutes of grumbling, the game finally got underway at 8:42 p.m. after first pitch was scheduled for 8:37. The delay didn't seem to bother Harvey, who sat down the Howie Kendrick, Jimmy Rollins and Adrian Gonzalez in order. 
Bottom of 1st: Brett Anderson followed Harvey's strong inning by retiring the Mets in order as well. Curtis Granderson grounded out to Anderson, David Wright struck out and Daniel Murphy flied out to centerfield. 
advertisement | advertise on newsday 
Top of 2nd: Former Met Justin Turner got the first hit of the game with a single to centerfield. Andre Ethier followed with another single to center. With the infield in, Carl Crawford hit a line drive through the 5-6 hole to load the bases with no outs. Yasmani Grandal hit a single past a diving Lucas Duda into rightfield to score Turner and Ethier. Granderson's throw went wide of third, allowing Crawford to score and Grandal to advance to second. Hernandez flied out to centerfield for the first out, and Harvey struck out Anderson for the second out. Wright made a leaping play on a hard-hit liner from Kendrick to end the inning. 
Bottom of 2nd: Yoenis Cespedes beat out an infield single to shortstop after Rollins took his time getting it over to first. Lucas Duda followed with a single to rightfield. Travis d'Arnaud hit a single to centerfield to score Cespedes and cut the Dodgers' lead to 3-1.
